plot.name: terra firma RIO-01 plotDA1
distnotes: All plots were mixed-age old-growth humid forests with no evidence of major human-induced disturbance for at least a century. In most cases the forests are unlikely to have ever experienced a major anthropogenic disturbance.

plot.name: terra firma RIO-02 plotDA2
distnotes: All plots were mixed-age old-growth humid forests with no evidence of major human-induced disturbance for at least a century. In most cases the forests are unlikely to have ever experienced a major anthropogenic disturbance.

sites.sitename: Biology of Forest Growth experimental plantation in Pierces Creek Forest
plot.name: Irrigated + Liquid Fertilized (IF)
distnotes: The IL treatment, which commenced in spring (September) 1984, provided a balanced nutrient input weekly in the irrigation water and was varied seasonally to match tree demand; annual inputs of N totaled 300 kg ha-1. After 1990, mineralization ofN in the soil and forest floor of the IL treatment was considered to be in excess of tree requirements, and fertilization was halted

sites.sitename: Biology of Forest Growth experimental plantation in Pierces Creek Forest
plot.name: Irrigated + Liquid Fertilized (IF)
distnotes: The stand was thinned in October 1988, removing 30% of the basal area for the IL treatment and 50% of the basal area for the I and C treatments.

plot.name: managed, 70-150 y.o. Fagus sylvatica stand
distnotes: he southwest of the tower (200-310deg) is an area with predominantly 113-year-old beech trees. Beech stands of different age (about 20-30, 70, 150 years old) surround the 113-year-old stand.

plot.name: managed, 70-150 y.o. Fagus sylvatica stand
distnotes: The forest has been managed as a shelterwood system since 1838. The beech forest around the tower is characterized by a sequence of relatively homogenous, even-aged stands at different stand age that were naturally regenerated under the shelter of a few remaining old trees of the previous stand.
